title: From prediction markets to interpretable collective intelligence
abstract:
Abstract.
We outline how to create a mechanism that provides an optimal way to elicit, from
an arbitrary group of experts, the probability of the truth of an arbitrary logical proposition together with collective information that has an explicit form and interprets this probability. Namely, we provide strong arguments for the possibility of the development of a self-resolving prediction market with play money that incentivizes
direct information exchange between experts. Such a system could, in particular,
motivate simultaneously many experts to collectively solve scientific or medical problems in a very efficient manner. We also note that in our considerations, experts are not assumed to be Bayesian.
